intro: Phyllanthus gardnerianus, commonly known as the African pear or wild pear, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to seasonal droughts, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an important plant in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
